N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 187.5 - Personal privacy protection law procedures

State Regulations

The following procedures shall be applicable to requests by
data subjects for the identification of, for access to, or for the amendment or
correction of records made under the provisions of Public Officers Law, article
6-A. Except as otherwise provided in this section, such requests shall also be
subject to the provisions of all other sections of this Part. (a) A request for the identification of
records shall include notice of any facts or relationship which the data
subject believes may have led to the creation and maintenance of such
records. (b) The department may
require satisfactory proof of the identity of the data subject by means of a
driver's license or other documentary and/or photographic
identification. (c) Place of
inspection or copying. Copies of records relating to a data subject shall be
made available by mail, or at the appropriate office of the department most
convenient to the data subject, upon payment of the fees required by section
187.6
of this Part. An appropriate
office shall be the office in which the record is maintained, the general
offices of the department at the State Education Building or Cultural Education

Building in Albany, or the Office of Professional Conduct in New York City, or
any office of the department more convenient to the data subject and with an
area of responsibility relevant to the purpose for which the record is
maintained. Inspection of original department records by a data subject shall
be at the office at which the records are regularly maintained. (d) Denial of request. Denial of a request by
a data subject for access to or for the amendment or correction of records
relating to a data subject will be in writing and will state the reason for the
denial, or that the information sought cannot be retrieved by use of the
description provided by the data subject or by the name or other identifier of
the data subject without extraordinary search methods. The notice of denial
shall include notice of the right to appeal, as provided in section
187.6
of this Part. Notes
